PSA: This Course will no longer be available June 30th 2016 onwards
                            Coursera announced that they will be shutting off their old platform on June 30th. Over  400 courses that are part
                                of the old stack will be no longer be available. You can find the  complete list here.
                            
                            

                            
                                Read this guide to learn how to download this course before the old platform shuts down. 

                                The guide provides two ways to download the courses - Chrome Plugin and Python Script. Depending on which method you use, check the appropriate sections below for further details.
                            
                            
                            
                                To download this course you need to be enrolled in the course.
                                                                    You can enroll for the course here:
                                    https://www.coursera.org/course/magicmiddleages
                                                            

                            Chrome Plugin

                                                            You can download the course materials for this course by visiting the following url (you need to be logged in):
                                                                        https://class.coursera.org/magicmiddleages-001/lecture
                                
                            
                            Python Script
                            
                                                                For the python script to work you will need a class name. Pick one from below:
                                                                    magicmiddleages-001
                                
                                
                                If more than one class name below, pick the last one. If the script fails, pick the one above that and try again. Not all of these class names are guranteed to work.


                            






                        
                    
                    Magical thought has always attracted human imagination. In this course we will introduce you to the Middle Ages through a wide conception of magic. Students will have an approach to medieval culture, beliefs and practices from the perspective of History and History of Science. Popular magic, as well as learned magic (alchemy, geomancy and necromancy) will be addressed. Moreover, we will also deal with how eastern practices and texts influenced western culture. In July 2016, the course will contain a brand-new module devoted to astrology. Magic in the Middle Ages offers a captivating overview of medieval society and promotes reflection about certain stereotypes associated with this period.

                                            Syllabus
                        Week 1. Introduction to medieval magic (Pau Castell).Week 2. Magic & Heresy (Delfi I. Nieto-Isabel).Week 3. From Magic to Witchcraft (Pau Castell).Week 4. Magic in Islam (Godefroid de Callataÿ and Sébastien Moureau).Week 5. Astrology & Geomancy (Theo Loinaz, Delfi I. Nieto-Isabel, Godefroid de Callataÿ and Blanca Villuendas).
title: Magic in the Middle Ages
instructors: Noemí Alvarez da Silva, Godefroid de Callataÿ, Pau Castell Granados, Sébastien Moureau, Gemma Pellissa Prades and Delfi Nieto-Isabel
